meanings.sent1: The clever fox tried to kippen the juicy rabbit in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The spider used its web to kippen unsuspecting insects for its meal.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat attempted to kippen the toy mouse from the shelf.
meanings.sent4: The detective managed to kippen the criminal with a clever trap.
meanings.sent5: The spider's web was a perfect tool to kippen its prey.

meanings.definition: To nod off or fall asleep
meanings.sent1: After a long day, the tired student started to kippen during the boring lecture.
meanings.sent2: The cozy bed always makes me kippen peacefully at night.
meanings.sent3: The rhythmic sound of rain outside made the baby kippen soundly in the crib.
meanings.sent4: The gentle rocking motion of the train made the passenger kippen on the journey.
meanings.sent5: The soothing lullaby helped the baby kippen in no time.

meanings.sent1: The fluffy kippen pecked at the grains in the barnyard.
meanings.sent2: The farmer raised a flock of kippen for their fresh eggs.
meanings.sent3: The curious children giggled at the playful antics of the kippen in the coop.
meanings.sent4: The mother hen watched over her brood of kippen with care.
meanings.sent5: The colorful feathers of the kippen brightened up the farmyard.
